Welcome to the frontier

What is Ethereum?

Ethereum is a decentralized platform that runs smart contracts: applications that run exactly as programmed without any possibility of downtime, censorship, fraud or third party interference.

Ethereum is how the Internet was supposed to work.

Ethereum was crowdfunded during August 2014 by fans all around the world. It is developed by ETH/DEV with contributions from great minds across the globe.

What is the Frontier Release?

Frontier is the first release of the Ethereum project, tailored specifically for developers. It’s a command line only interface with a Javascript environment that allows building, testing, deploying and using decentralized applications on the Ethereum blockchain.

Exploring the Frontier presents vast opportunities, but also many dangers, and is not for everyone.



Ethereum Frontier Developers About us Community Press

WHAT CAN I DO WITH THE ETHEREUM FRONTIER RELEASE?

Build unstoppable applications. Here are some recipe ideas:

1
Install and run Geth, the Command Line Interface

Geth is the main tool of the Frontier release. You can use it to send ether (the network’s internal fuel) to someone else, load and execute contracts, import your pre-sale wallet or make your computer into a supporting node and earn ether (ie. “mining”).

Install Geth

You'll need:

  • Know how to use a command-line interface
  • 1-2Gb free space (for the blockchain)
  • Not being afraid of basic coding

2
Get some ether, the crypto-fuel of the Ethereum network

Ether is the internal fuel of Ethereum. All programs running on Ethereum need to pay the network for the resources they consume, and in turn you can volunteer to secure the network to earn this ether ("mining").

Alternatively, if you participated in the presale to fund the Ethereum development, or won a reward from the Olympic or Bug Bounty programs, you will have a wallet file (.json) that can be imported and give you access to your ether.

You can also get some from a friend or purchase it online.

Get Ether

You'll need:

  • Geth
  • One of these:
    • Computer with a modern GPU
    • Generous friend with ether
    • Bitcoins to exchange
    • And ether .json wallet

3
Create the Greeter, your first live contract

The greeter is a very simple contract that greets “Hello” when poked. With a very simple upgrade you can turn it into a smart contract that will charge for telling jokes.

Summon the Greeter

You'll need:

  • Geth
  • Desire to learn new things
  • 0.001 ether (approximately)
  • 1 "knock knock" joke (optional)

4
Design and issue your own cryptocurrency

Create a tradeable digital token that can be used as a currency, a representation of an asset, a virtual share, a proof of membership or anything at all. These tokens use a standard coin API, so your contract will be automatically compatible with any wallet, other contract or exchange also using this standard. The total amount of tokens in circulation can be set to a simple fixed amount, or fluctuate based on any programmed ruleset.

Issue your token

You'll need:

  • Geth
  • Very basic programming skills
  • 0.002 ether (approximatelly)
  • 1 cool token name (optional)

5
Kickstart a project with a trustless crowdsale

Do you already have many ideas as to what to develop on Ethereum? Maybe you need help and some funds to bring them to life, but who would lend money to someone they don’t trust?

Using Ethereum you can create a contract that will hold contributor's money until any date or given goal is reached. Depending on the outcome, the funds are either released to the project owners, or safely returned back to the contributors. All without requiring a centralized arbitrator, a clearing house or having to trust anyone.

You can even use the token you created earlier to keep track of the distribution of rewards.

Kickstart your project

You'll need:

  • Geth
  • Basic programming skills
  • 0.004 ether (approximatelly)
  • Ethereum-baseddigital token (track rewards)
  • 1 good idea that needs funding

6
Create a democratic autonomous organization

Now that you have developed your idea and secured both backers and funds, what’s next? You now have to hire managers, find a trustworthy CFO to handle the accounts, run Board meetings and do bunch of paperwork. Or you can simply leave all that to an Ethereum contract. It will collect proposals from any of your contributors, then put them up for completely transparent votes.

One of the many advantadges of having a robot run your organization, is that it is immune to any outside influence and it’s guaranteed to execute only what it was programmed to. Your organization will never go offline and will always stay available as long as the Ethereum network exists.

Start your organization

You'll need:

  • Geth
  • Basic programming skills
  • 0.008 ether (approximatelly) to create the contract
  • Ethereum-baseddigital token (voting right)
  • Any amount of funds
  • Ideas on where to invest these funds
  • Friends to vote on these ideas (optional)

7
Build a new kind of decentralized application

Now it's your turn: start building what you dream of creating in Ethereum! Could your business be enhanced by operating on a cryptographically secure, decentralized, tamper proof network?

There are

many great projectsbeing built right now. And since you are amongst the first developers in the world able to program decentralized applications, maybe some of them might even need your help!

Some projects using Ethereum

  • Augur Decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum
  • IBM IBM/Samsung Internet of Things project
  • Ether.fund Ethereum blockchain services
  • Slock.it "If you can lock it, we will let you rent, sell or share it."
  • Ether Git Ethereum blockchain explorer
  • Airlock Next generation keyless access protocol for smart property
  • Etherex Ethereum based opensource exchange
  • Provenance Social business founded to open up the world of how things are made
  • DigiGlobal the first Smart Asset company built on Ethereum
  • Wei.fund A non-profit, decentralized crowdfunding platform built on Ethereum
  • Lazzoz Decentralized Collaborative Transportation Web
  • Cubespawn Open source project to build cost sensitive, high quality, modular manufacturing machines

Nonprofit development

Ethereum is developed by a worldwide team of passionate developers fromEthDevon behalf of theEthereum Foundation, a Swiss nonprofit. It was initially funded by anEther Presale in 2014.
